p: For serum samples from horses based in Occitanie, 13.7% of these samples ( n = 41) were below 85 mm 2, including 20 samples with SRH antibody titer = 0mm 2 and 21 samples seroconverted (57.7 ± 20.2 mm 2). 31.4% of samples were ≥85 mm 2 and <154 mm 2 (127.3 ± 18.9 mm 2; n = 94) and 54.8% were ≥154 mm 2 (186.9 ± 21.3 mm 2; n = 164) ( Figure 2). The serum samples from horses located in this region were significantly lower compared to the serum samples tested for the Normandy ( p-value = 0.04). No significant difference has been shown between breeding and diagnosis categories. The frequency of serum samples, for both categories, with SRH antibody titers above the clinical protection threshold was 87%.
